results.title: Utilizing Proteomic Approaches to Uncover the Neuroprotective Effects of ACE Inhibitors: Implications for Alzheimer's Disease Treatment
results.text_hl: Two types of angiotensin-converting enzyme (@GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@) inhibitors, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_benazepril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C044946 @@@benazepril HCl@@@, were tested in @<m>DISEASE_Neuroblastoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009447 @@@neuroblastoma@@@ cells and found to upregulate @GENE_LRP1B @GENE_53353 @@@low-density lipoprotein-receptor-related protein 1B@@@ (@GENE_LRP1B @GENE_53353 @@@LRP1B@@@) and @GENE_YWHAZ @GENE_7534 @@@14-3-3 protein zeta/delta@@@.

citations.NLM: Yang MH, Ho TC, Chang CC, Su YS, Yuan CH, Chuang KP, Tyan YC. Utilizing Proteomic Approaches to Uncover the Neuroprotective Effects of ACE Inhibitors: Implications for Alzheimer's Disease Treatment Molecules. 2023 Aug 8;28(16):. PMID: 37630190
